title: [bug] tab completion on an undefined variable cause crash
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.10.9
OS & Version: Windows

#### Expected behaviour
When tab completing a variable which is null or undefined should not crash geth and should be handled safely.
An example is to output nothing, just like when attempting to do this on a variable which does not exist.

#### Actual behaviour
When assigning a variable undefined or null, once you attempt to access a none existing property of that variable, geth will crash.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
It was originally reported to me by a user who thought that they needed to assign the return of miner.start() to a variable in order to stop the miner later.

m = miner.start()
m. <<< press tab

Or just 

m = undefined
m. <<< press tab
#### Backtrace

````
> u = undefined
undefined
> u.panic: TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object

goroutine 278 [running]:
github.com/dop251/goja.(*Runtime).typeErrorResult(...)
        C:/Users/owner/go/pkg/mod/github.com/dop251/goja@v0.0.0-20200721192441-a695b0cdd498/runtime.go:283
github.com/dop251/goja.valueNull.ToObject(0xc003919e00, 0x7ff68c2fb000)
        C:/Users/owner/go/pkg/mod/github.com/dop251/goja@v0.0.0-20200721192441-a695b0cdd498/value.go:337 +0x88
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.getCompletions(0xc003919e00, 0xc0052bd8b8, 0x2, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        C:/Users/owner/Documents/projects/go-ethereum/internal/jsre/completion.go:50 +0xe5
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.(*JSRE).CompleteKeywords.func1(0xc003919e00)
        C:/Users/owner/Documents/projects/go-ethereum/internal/jsre/completion.go:31 +0x4d
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.(*JSRE).runEventLoop(0xc003870d80)
        C:/Users/owner/Documents/projects/go-ethereum/internal/jsre/jsre.go:204 +0x851
created by github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/jsre.New
        C:/Users/owner/Documents/projects/go-ethereum/internal/jsre/jsre.go:79 +0x159
````
